intro: Agathosma elegans, commonly known as the sweet cycad, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Agathosma elegans is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
